author: zsfelfoldi
content: Hi! I have a question that's slightly related to withdrawals: how hard would it be to make it possible to change your validator key without stopping validation? Changing your keys sometimes might be good for security reasons. It's fine if you can only do it while proposing a block, I guess it shouldn't be extremely hard or expensive, it does not affect the security properties of consensus.

author: ralexstokes
content: in theory, its doable but would lead to some consensus complexity -- you can get the same effect by simply exiting as a validator and re-entering the validator set w/ new keys if you need to rotate and this solution skips having to bring the rotation logic in-protocol

author: jgm
content: Yeah, changing the validator key would be painful both in the protocol and outside it (the validator key is commonly used to track validators in explorers, for example).
